intro: [WRONG START] parablechnum loxense var. stenophyllum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved parablechnum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are narrow and linear, adapted to reduce water loss in its native habitat. The flowers are small and clustered, often displaying a range of colors from yellow to red, attracting various pollinators.
